Summarize the article "Why Cats Make Bad Pets".
Cats make bad pets for a variety of reasons. Their natural hunting instincts can lead to destruction in the home, they are often independent, and require constant upkeep when it comes to grooming and vet care.

The article "Why Cats Make Bad Pets" argues that cats may not be ideal pets for several reasons. Firstly, their innate hunting instincts can result in damage within the home environment. Additionally, cats are frequently independent, which may not align with the expectations of those seeking a more interactive pet. Furthermore, cats necessitate ongoing maintenance, including regular grooming and veterinary care, which can be demanding for some pet owners.
